titles.title: Täʾamrä ʿUraʾel "Miracles of Uriel" / Täʾamrä ʾIyäsus "Miracles of Jesus" / Täʾamrä Zä-Mikaʾel ʾArägawi "Miracles of Zä-Mikaʾel ʾArägawi" / Täʾamrä Maryam "Miracles of Mary"

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Täʾamrä ʿUraʾel "Miracles of Uriel": 2 miracles (fols. 2ra-5vb) II) Täʾamrä ʾIyäsus "Miracles of Jesus": 2 miracles (fol. 6ra-6vb), incomplete III-1a) Mäṣḥafä śǝrʿat, Introductory rite of al-Muʿallaqah (fol. 7ra-7vb), incomplete IV) Täʾamrä Zä-Mikaʾel ʾArägawi "Miracles of Zä-Mikaʾel ʾArägawi": one miracle (fol. 7vb), incomplete III) Täʾamrä Maryam "Miracles of Mary" (fols. 8ra-254va) III-1b) Mäṣḥafä śǝrʿat, Introductory rite of al-Muʿallaqah (fols. 8ra-13vb) III-2) Introductory exhortation and hymns (fols. 14ra-16vb) III-3) ʾƎsäggǝd läki wä-ʾǝweddǝsäki ... "I worship Thee ..." (fols. 16vb-17vb) III-4a) Täʾamrä Maryam "Miracles of Mary": 16 miracles (fols. 17vb-25vb, 216ra-251ra) III-4b) Täʾamrä Maryam "Miracles of Mary": 113 miracles (fols. 26ra-215vb, 253ra-254va)
Additiones 1-3.

copyists.copyist: Gäbrä Mädḫǝn is mentioned as the scribe of Text III-1a on fol. 7va, hand c. ʾƎśśetä Maryam is mentioned as the scribe of Text III-4a on fol. 251ra, hand e.

donors.donor: ʾAbunä Gäbrä Maryam is mentioned in supplication formulas throughout Text I (hand a). The names Gäbrä Śǝllase and Gäbrä ʾAmlak are written in Text II (fol. 6vb, hand b). ʾAbunä Bǝʾǝse ʾƎgziʾabǝḥer is mentioned as the commissioner in the concluding supplication formula of Text III-4a; furthermore, his name is written throughout Texts III-2 and III-4a (hand e). According to Additio 2, Gäbrä Mänfäs Qǝddus donated the Ms. to Däbrä Dammo; he is also mentioned on fols. 83rb, 215vb (Text III-4b, hand d).

dcomments.dcomment: According to Additio 2, the book was donated in the time of King Lǝbnä Dǝngǝl (r. 1508-40). Quires III, V-XXVIII, XXXIV date to the first half of the 16th cent. Quires IV, XXIX-XXXIII date to the 18th cent. Quires I and II date to a more recent time (19th cent.?). Fol. 252 (with the miniature) originates from an old codex (15th cent.?).

txstates.txstate: The back board is broken and crudely repaired. The leather cover is perforated. The Ms. was resewn. Tears carefully amended on fols. 5, 68, 108, 148, 164.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (the back board is broken and crudely repaired) covered with reddish-brown leather (quarter cover). Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover. Quires XII, XIV and XXXIV are reinforced with parchment guards.

inks.ink: Black, red (hand a: strong red, hand b, d and e: vivid red, hand c: strong vermillion).

squires.squire:
<I(5; s.l.: 1, stub after 5/fols. 1r-5v)> – <II(2/fol. 6r-7v)> – III(6/fols. 8r-13v) – <IV(12/fols. 14r-25v)> –V(8/fols. 26r-33v) – VI(8/fols. 34r-41v) – VII(8/fols. 42r-49v) – VIII(8/fols. 50r-57v) – IX(8/fols. 58r-65v) – X(8/fols. 66r-73v) – XI(8/fols. 74r-81v) – XII(8/fols. 82r-89v) – XIII(8/fols. 90r-97v) – XIV(8; s.l.: 2, stub after 7; 7, stub after 2/fols. 98r-105v) – XV(8/fols. 106r-113v) – XVI(7; s.l.: 3, stub after 5/fols. 114r-120v) – XVII(8/fols. 121r-128v) – XVIII(8/fols. 129r-136v) – XIX(8/fols. 137r-144v) – XX(8/fols. 145r-152v) – XXI(7; s.l.: 4, stub before 5/fols. 153r-159v) – XXII(8/fols. 160r-167v) – XXIII(8/fols. 168r-175v) – XXIV(8/fols. 176r-183v) – XXV(8/fols. 184r-191v) – XXVI(8/fols. 192r-199v) – XXVII(8/fols. 200r-207v) – XXVIII(8/fols. 208r-215v) – <XXIX(8/fols. 216r-223v) – XXX(8; s.l.: 2, stub after 7; 7, stub after 2/fols. 224r-231v) – XXXI(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 2/fols. 232r-239v) – XXXII(8/fols. 240r-247v) – XXXIII(4/fols. 248r-251v)> – XXXIV(4; s.l.: {1}, stub after stub of 2; 2, stub after stub of 4; 3, stub after 3; 4, stub before 4/fols. 252r-255v).
Quires I and II were added at more recent time. Quires IV, XXIX-XXXIII were probably added shortly after the core of the Ms. (quires III, V-XXVIII, XXXIV) was produced. Fol. 252 originates from a different, older codex.

taunit.mr-info: Text area I: fols. 2ra-5vb (quire I). 18.8 x 16.5 width x height. All data are for fol. 3r.
taunit.ln-info: Text area I: 20; text area II: 20; text area III: 18; text area IV: 19.
taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks (of the slit-type in quires XXIX, XXX) are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

taunit.mr-info: Text area II: fols. 6ra-7va (quire II). 15.0 x 15.8 width x height. All data are for fol. 7r.
taunit.ln-info: Text area I: 20; text area II: 20; text area III: 18; text area IV: 19.
taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks (of the slit-type in quires XXIX, XXX) are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

taunit.mr-info: Text area III: fols. 8ra-13vb, 26ra-215vb, 253ra-254va (quires III, V-XXVIII, XXXIV). 17.6 x 19.6 width x height. All data are for fol. 9r.
taunit.ln-info: Text area I: 20; text area II: 20; text area III: 18; text area IV: 19.
taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks (of the slit-type in quires XXIX, XXX) are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

taunit.mr-info: Text area IV: fols. 14ra-25vb, 216ra-251ra (quires IV, XXIX-XXXIII). 18.6 x 20.1 width x height. All data are for fol. 15r.
taunit.ln-info: Text area I: 20; text area II: 20; text area III: 18; text area IV: 19.
taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks (of the slit-type in quires XXIX, XXX) are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

ptypeofscripts.ptypeofscript: Hands a-c: 19th century. Hand d: 16th century. Hand e: 18th century.

phandwritings.phandwriting: Hand a: fine. Hand b: fine. Hand c: mediocre. Hand d: fine. Hand e: neat and regular.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Hand a: fols. 2ra-5vb; quire I (Text I). Fine, rounded script with tall, broadly spaced, but irregularly slanted letters. Hand b: fol. 6ra-vb; quire II (Text II). Regular, with rounded letters. Hand c: fol. 7ra-vb; quire II (Texts III-1a, IV). Right-sloping letters with notable hairlines. Hand d: fols. 8ra-13vb, 26ra-215vb, 253ra-254va; quires III, V-XXVIII, XXXIV (Texts III-1b, III-4b). Fine, occasionally irregular (e.g., fols. 80v-83r) script with slender, tall and broadly spaced letters. It shows some distinctive features: - some letters have the hook vowel marker at the top, not in the middle: e.g., ው, ዮ, ድ, ጽ - the hook vowel marker of ጵ is attached to the left side of the vertical stroke - the letters ፅ and ዕ are usually cone-shaped, downward oriented - archaic forms of numbers ፪, ፬, and ፮. Hand e: fols. 14ra-25vb, 216ra-251ra; quires IV, XXIX-XXXIII (Texts III-2, III-3, III-4a). The handwriting is characterized by finely shaped, slender and slightly right-sloping letters. Contrary to hand d, the letter መ in all vowel orders is written with the loops separated. The letters ፈ and ረ in all vowel orders and ሥ are formed with a long, diagonal stroke. The vowel marker of ስ is notably long.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; names of the donors of Texts I, II, III-2, III-4a; groups of lines on the incipit page of Texts I, III-1b, III-2, III-4b, incipit of all other texts, incipit of sections of most of the texts and section numbers of Text III-4b; the word sälam "salutation" in Texts III-1b, III-2; directives for the ministers in Text III-1b; elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers; Ethiopic numerals (Texts III-1b, III-4b) or their elements in all other texts.

abbreviations.abbreviation: In Text III-1b: ይበል፡ ዲ፡ for ይበል፡ ዲያቆን፡ (fol. 13rb)

otherdetails.otherdetail:
Text III-1b, partly with interlineal musical notation, contains: - Ṣälotä zä-yǝbǝl ʾǝmqǝdmä yanbǝbu täʾamriha lä-ʾәgzǝʾtǝnä Maryam ... "Prayer recited before reading the Miracles of our Lady Mary. .." (fols. 12vb-13vb) - Excerpt from the Gospel of John (Jn. 19:25-27) (fol. 13vb).
Text III-2 includes the hymns: - ʾO-ʾәgzǝʾtǝyä qǝddǝst dǝngǝl bä-kǝlʾe Maryam wäladitä ʾamlak ... "O my Lady, Holy Two-fold Virgin Mary, Godbearing ..." (fol. 15va-vb) - ʾO-ʾәgzǝʾtǝyä qǝddǝst dǝngǝl Maryam Mariham ʾǝmmu lä-ʾIyäsus Krǝstos kähali ... "O my Lady, Holy Virgin Mary, Mother of Jesus Christ the Almighty ..." (fols. 15vb-16ra) (cp. ChRep no. 373) - Sälam läki ʾo-ʾәgzǝʾtǝyä qǝddǝst dǝngǝl Maryam ʾǝmmä mädḫǝn wä-ʾǝmmä bǝrhan ... "Salutation to you, o my Lady, Holy Virgin Mary, Mother of the Saviour and Mother of the Light ..." (fol. 16ra-vb).
All miracles of St. Mary are numbered. Miracles 1-3 of Text III-4b are followed by a hymn: - ʾO-ʾәgzǝʾtǝyä Maryam ʾǝm-betä mängǝśt wä-ʾǝm-betä kahǝnät ... "O my Lady Mary, from the house of Kingdom and the house of Priesthood ..." (fol. 28va) - ʾO-ʾәgzǝʾtǝyä Maryam ḫoḫǝtä mǝśraq zä-täśämäyki ... "O my Lady Mary, Threshold of the East have you been called ... " (fol. 29ra). - ʾO-ʾәgzǝʾtǝyä Maryam mälakotawit pilas zä-adḫǝnkiyo ʾǝm-kwǝnäne lä-aḥadu-mänäkos ... "O my Lady Mary, Divine Temple ..." (fol. 29vb)
Fol. 252v contains an ʾarke-hymn addressing different saints and an ownership note, mentioning a certain ʾabunä Täṭämqä Mädḫǝn, son of ʾabba Samuʾel (fol. 252vb).

additional.cont: Fol. 12v (upper margin): Sälam läki ḫoḫətä məśraq... “Salutation to you, Threshold of the East…”
additional.det: The hymn contains musical notation. It is probably written in hand e.

additional.tran: Fol. 254va: In praise of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit, I, Gäbrä Mänfäs Qǝddus, son of Gäbrä Krǝstos and of ˀAśratä Maryam, donated the book “The Miracles of Our Lady Mary” to the place of ˀabunä ˀArägawi so that it might be for me an assistance on the day of judgement while our king was Lǝbnä Dǝngǝl and nəburä ˀəd ˀabba Samuˀel and qäs gäbäz ˀabba Gäbrä Krǝstos and räqämäˀasära ˀabba Habtä ˀIyäsus and qǝntan ˀabba Ṗawlos. And while our mämhǝr was ˀabunä Tärbinos so that it might not be taken out from the house, but it is only for seeing it inside it. (The one who takes it out) shall be excommunicated by the mouth of Our Lady Mary and by the mouth of ˀabunä ˀArägawi and of ˀabunä ˀAḥadu ˀAmlak. And by the mouth of the 15 Prophets and 12 Apostles, by the mouth of the 318 Orthodox [fol. 254vb] (Fathers of Nicaea) and by the mouth of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit. For ever and ever. Amen.
additional.det: The note is hastily written probably in hand d.

additional.cont: Fol. 255ra: Condemnation for those who steal the book.
additional.det: The unfinished note is written in a mediocre hand, probably in recent time.

extras.extra: - The title ተአምረ፡ ማርያም is written on the front board with black modern paint. - The internal number of the monastic library (508) is written on the inner side of the front cover. - Erasures are marked with parallel lines: fols. 11rb, 32ra (several lines), 35vb, 53ra, 70rb, 133rb, 134vb, 141rb, 170rb, 179rb, 190rb, 253rb. - Erasures without marking: fols. 14vb, 62va (several lines). - Omitted words are written interlineally: fols. 14ra, 219ra, 249vb; an omitted passage is written in the upper margin in a secondary fine hand: fol. 11rb. - Corrections are written over erased words and passages: fols. 24rb-va, 25ra, 29ra, 34va, 37rb, 55rb, 58vb, 63ra, 133va, 141rb, 148ra, 173ra, 183vb, 213vb, 222ra, 225rb, 232va, 238vb, 239rb, 240ra; in hand e: fol. 175va; in a secondary hand: fols. 74vb, 83rb, 114ra, 213va. - Cues (numerals) for the rubricator: fols. 86r, 87v, 88r, 93r, 94v.

miniature.details: Legend: ሥዕለ፡ ሚካኤል፡ “Image of Michael”. ሥዕለ፡ ማርያም፡ ወወልዳ፡ “Image of Mary and her Son”. ሥዕለ፡ ገብርኤል፡ “Image of Gabriel”. The leaf originates from a different older (15th cent.?) codex.

frames.frame: Fol. 8r (incipit page of Text III-1b): elaborate coloured (vivid red) ornamental band with one central and two lateral pendants reaching the middle of the page; interlaces and floral motifs. Fol. 26r (incipit page of Text III-4b): elaborate coloured (vivid red) ornamental band with one central and two lateral pendants reaching the middle of the page; interlaces and geometric motifs.
